reviews.text: The nicest staff, had such a wonderful experience

I‚Äôve been a regular at this Blue Bottle location ‚Äîabout 4‚Äì5 times per week‚Äîand I‚Äôve generally had good experiences, which is why this visit was so disappointing.

When I came in recently, one of the baristas (a red-haired Eastern European girl employee) was standing around chatting and gossiping with a coworker while I placed my order. I asked for my coffee black, and right away she made a loud, sexually derogatory comment to her coworker. It felt unprofessional and uncomfortable in a public workspace.

After getting my coffee, I asked another worker for half-and-half on the side so I could add it myself. I ended up with extra half-and-half and didn‚Äôt want to dump it into the small trash bin at the counter, so I politely asked if they could take it. The same barista immediately gave me an attitude and told me to throw it away ‚Äúaround the corner.‚Äù I said I didn‚Äôt see a trash can, and instead of helping, she stared me down and made additional derogatory remarks about me to her coworker within earshot.

That kind of hostility and disrespect is not what I expect from Blue Bottle, especially at a place I‚Äôve supported so consistently. I hope management addresses this, because no customer should be made to feel uncomfortable or mocked for a simple, polite request.

ENLY is one of my favorite coffee spots in NYC because of its unique matcha drink options.

Atmosphere: The space is small with a clean aesthetic. The front of the shop has a small seating area while the length of the rest of the space adorns candles on the walls of the left side and the coffee counter on the right side.
Service: The ladies here are all business. They will get your order, make you drink well, and hand it to you within minutes. People were coming in and out, so their wait times are not bad at all considering how many people come through the door.
Menu items: I got their Strawberry Shortcake Matcha with whole milk, and it was worth the $ spent. The matcha wasn't sweet (which I love), and the added strawberry puree and thick, creamy topping made the drink taste as good as it looked.

I'll be recommending this spot to anyone I know visiting the city and will definitely be making my way back next time I'm up there!

Dark Matter is a colorful coffee shop planted on Bowery and 1st. large amount of space and seating options for enjoying coffee, doing some work, catching up with a friend, or just being in your head for solace. the space is is vibrant and give its nods to music in the decor, vibe, and personality of its various locations spread across America. while Dark Matter has a great upbeat energy--it's not crazy  obnoxiously loud visually or sound-wise...it's a good balance for people who want the kick of caffeine and some stimuli without it being frenzied and hectic. the coffee? really good...you have choices here as they rotate coffees daily for their "drip" and you can pick from a variety of coffee roasts for an Americano or whatever your go-to coffee is. every time I have been here, I typically ask what roasts are available and choose accordingly or go for the ever-changing drip coffee. tbh, if you don't know what you like based on a written description of the coffees...just tell the counter person and barista the types of flavors you like in a coffee and they won't steer you wrong as there is a fair amount of variety in what is served here in terms of flavor profile and roast type or geography. ya got options, kid! the folks here are knowledgeable about coffee in a non-robotic way...there's genuine enthusiasm behind the coffee and when they talk about it. tbh, that's refreshing when often times you go to places and know you're being sold a commodity whereas as at Dark Matter...you're talking to people who enjoy making and drinking coffee and haven't made it into a total "transaction"...yeah it is a business, but you get that they are about the caffeine culture and that's aces in my book. whether you're in the area looking for a casual cup of coffee or a destination...Dark Matter has the the relaxed flexibility to make the trip there a memorable and flavorful one. and obviously, you can buy bags of their various roasts if you rather brew in the comfort of your home. drink up, amigos!

name: In Common NYC - A Breakfast & Brunch Restaurant

reviews.text: If you‚Äôre looking for a great place to have breakfast, you should definitely come here. The service is quick and friendly, and the food is excellent. I would highly recommend it to anyone.

‚ô°Hidden Gem Near Hudson Yards ‚Äì Incredible Hospitality!!!
My family and I stopped by In Common NYC for brunch and were absolutely blown away. From the moment we walked in, we were treated like regulars. The owner personally came by to welcome us and our waitress was attentive without being intrusive ‚Äì you can tell the team genuinely cares about every guest.

The menu focuses on simple dishes executed perfectly with fresh, seasonal ingredients. We tried the shakshuka toast, French toast and avocado toast, and each dish was packed with flavor and beautifully presented. The seeded sourdough and whipped ricotta were standouts, and the coffee ‚Äì sourced from an Australian boutique roaster ‚Äì was one of the best cups I‚Äôve had in NYC.

Even though it was busy, everything ran smoothly and we never felt rushed. The atmosphere is bright, airy and relaxed ‚Äì a perfect spot to catch up with friends, fuel up before exploring Hudson Yards or enjoy a laid‚Äëback weekend brunch. Whether you‚Äôre a New Yorker looking for a new favorite cafe or a tourist wanting an authentic taste of the city‚Äôs brunch scene, this is a must-visit. We left feeling like part of the community and can‚Äôt wait to return. Five stars!

‚ÄãI highly recommend this spot! It's a must-visit for any coffee lover.

name: GRIND THE NYC COFFEE SHOP & BAGEL HOUSE

reviews.text: staffs are very friendly!

I‚Äôm not usually the type of person who writes reviews, but I need to mention something that has been bothering me about this place. It‚Äôs a nice caf√© overall ‚Äî most of the staff are friendly and the service is generally quick.

However, I had stopped coming here for a while because of one particular barista (blond hair, blue eyes). The first time I ordered a drip coffee, he raised his voice at me saying, ‚ÄòWhat coffee do you want? We have espresso, we have filter,‚Äô which was completely unnecessary. Another barista stepped in at that moment. As someone who has worked as a barista in Brooklyn for a long time, I‚Äôd say that when someone orders a ‚Äòdrip‚Äô or simply says ‚Äòcoffee,‚Äô it‚Äôs usually clear what they mean. Even if it wasn‚Äôt, raising his voice over a basic question wasn‚Äôt the right approach ‚Äî I was literally just placing my order.

On another visit, the same barista took my payment and pressured me to leave a tip. I normally tip anyway, but I didn‚Äôt feel comfortable tipping someone whose service had already been unpleasant. I still tipped out of courtesy, but the pressure was really off-putting.

Later, during another visit, he interrupted a conversation I was having with another barista and tried to stir up the interaction for no reason. At that point, it just felt like intentional discomfort. I didn‚Äôt even want to make eye contact ‚Äî I just wanted to leave. It reached a ‚Äòplease stop bothering me‚Äô level.

FYI, lol.
